guardian.title: PlayStation and Xbox facing issues after Christmas Day hack
guardian.topComment: Love the tone of the article. People might want to spend time off from work playing video games? Let's make fun of them!

guardian.title: Foreign jihadis change face of Syrian civil war
guardian.topComment:
The West should never have supported armed opposition to the Assad Regime-negotiation would have taken place with the right approach and persuasion
Now there is only devastation.
It may be an unpopular opinion but in the end only an Assad victory can bring back any form of stability.
"Jihadists" -whatever they are; appear simply as looters and burners out for what-ever plunder they can get..
It must be appalling for Syrians to watch whilst their land,possessions and relatives even are grabbed from them by outsiders.

guardian.title: Watching The Interview on Christmas: 'We don't take orders from Kim Jong-un'
guardian.topComment: Wasn't that what they were precisely doing a week or so ago. This is looking more & more pathetic.

guardian.title: Zombie nativity scene ordered taken down by Ohio town bureaucrats
guardian.topComment: Isn't Easter a better fit for zombie Jesus?

guardian.title: Federal officials may use little-known civil rights statute in police shooting cases
guardian.topComment: Good for the DoJ, I'm happy that they're seeing a pattern in police shootings. 14 bullets is clearly excessive force with the intent to kill the only other witness to the events.
